courseDescription: Students will discuss and learn the training process including advantages and benefits of swimming, principles of training, training procedures, evaluation and motivation, and minor annoyances. Stroke mechanics and improvement and information for triathletes.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading and motivating a team of swimmers

courseDescription: Development of the basic water safety skills and knowledge to make one reasonably safe in the water.
Instruction in all strokes will be covered.
Development of the skills and knowledge designed to save the life of another in the event of an emergency in the water.  Red Cross certification.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Coordinating with other lifeguards and emergency responders
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Quick decision making in high-stress situations
Identifying potential hazards and preventing accidents
Evaluating emergency situations and determining the best course of action
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Maintaining orderly and safe swimming environments

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide the student with knowledge and skills in water safety and teaching techniques for certification to teach swimming, lifesaving, rescue and water safety courses.  Red Cross Water Safety Instructor Certificate upon successful completion.

The 1-credit option of this course focuses on yoga postures and breathing exercises. The 2-credit option provides a foundation for the understanding and practice of Hatha yoga in its complete form. Course covers yoga postures, breathing exercises, philosophy, and meditation.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting yoga postures for different abilities
Adjusting breathing exercises to individual needs

courseDescription: This course is designed to guide students through several processes in rock climbing.  Students will be able to properly fit a harness, tie in to the system, use passive and active belay devices, and perform basic rescues.  The class will also focus on proper climbing technique and injury prevention.  Additionally, rock climbing facility administration will be discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Usage of passive and active belay devices

courseDescription: Designed for students who self-identify as having social, cognitive, emotional, psychological, or physical limitations who would benefit from a small group and/or individualized fitness/nutritional training program. Students will learn the basic principles about cardiovascular/aerobic training and resistance/weight training to increase flexibility, balance and overall fitness. Upon completion, students should be able to plan and implement a personal, lifelong fitness program based on their individual needs, abilities, goals and interests.  Course will also include classes on nutrition to increase overall wellness.
Technical and Digital Skills: Designing a personal, lifelong fitness program
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Working in a small group environment
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying and adapting exercises to meet individual abilities and limitations
Evaluating and adjusting personal fitness program for optimal results
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and implementing a personal fitness program
Setting and achieving fitness and wellness goals

courseDescription: Designed to allow students an individualized weight training program.  The program will include use of free weights, universal, and other appropriate tools for the variety of weight training differences.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of universal weight training tools
Ability to use appropriate tools for different weight training exercises
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate with trainers and peers
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing and improving weight training techniques
Adjusting exercise routines to meet individual fitness goals
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Adherence to safety guidelines and protocols
Planning and structuring individualized weight training program

courseDescription: The fundamentals of golf, stance, grip, swing, rules, and etiquette are presented.  Driving range and golf course may be used.  Students pay all fees.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communicating with other players and staff
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating best grip and stance for different situations

courseDescription: The student is introduced to the various practical skills and methods of self-defense. Judo, Aikido, Jujutsu, and Karate are combined to explore the most effective means to defend oneself.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Understanding and responding to body language

courseDescription: This course is designed to give the student further instruction and practice in the various practical skills and methods of self-defense.
Technical and Digital Skills: Use of self-defense tools and equipment

courseDescription: This course is designed to give the traditional Karate training ('Art of Empty Hand') to the beginning student. It emphasizes the traditional mode of training with mental and physical discipline. Formal Kata, defensive skills, punches, kicks, and blocking techniques are introduced.
This course is designed to give the student further instruction and practice in traditional Karate.
This course is designed to introduce further instruction and practice in traditional martial art aspects of Karate-doh. Philosophical understanding and high level of skill proficiency are emphasized.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Respect and courtesy in martial arts

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide the theoretical framework of Karatedo that embodies the higher principle of physical and mental dynamics and aims to achieve the advanced skills in Karatedo.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of physical and mental dynamics in Karatedo

courseDescription: Course is designed to introduce the fundamental dynamics of Aikido principle. It contains the fundamental skills in body dynamics, body movements, safety landing, defensive pattern drills, and overall understanding of Aikido as a classical art form. Course provide comprehensive information on the philosophical and aesthetic aspects of Aikido.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Understanding and appreciating the aesthetics of Aikido
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Understanding the philosophical aspects of Aikido

courseDescription: Course is designed to introduce the intermediate level of Aikido dynamics. It contains the basics of fundamental skills in body dynamics, body movements, safety landing, intermediate level of defensive pattern drills, and overall understanding of Aikido as a classical art form.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Quick decision-making in response to partner's movements
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Respect for classical art form traditions

courseDescription: Course is designed to introduce the advanced level of Aikido dynamics. It contains training in advanced skills in body dynamics, body movements, defensive pattern drills, and overall understanding of Aikido theory and application as a classical art form.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of Aikido theory and application
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing and executing advanced Aikido techniques
Adapting body movements in response to opponent
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and executing complex Aikido movements

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide the theoretical framework of Aikido that embodies the mental and physical dynamics of the martial arts discipline of Aikido.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of the theoretical framework of Aikido
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and structuring Aikido training sessions

courseDescription: This course addresses the basic principles of progressive weight training.  Objectives of the course include knowledge of various weight-training systems, proper use of weight-training equipment, and effective record-keeping to monitor individual progress.
This course is designed to introduce the student to a complete physical fitness program that strengthens the heart and lungs, and tones up the muscles.
Technical and Digital Skills: Ability to perform exercises that strengthen the heart and lungs
Ability to perform exercises that tone up muscles
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate physical discomfort or difficulties during the session
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Understanding how different exercises impact different muscle groups
Ability to modify exercises to suit personal fitness level

courseDescription: Zumba is a Latin inspired, dance-fitness class that incorporates Latin and International music with dance movements.  It is a high calorie-burning fitness class that features fast and slow rhythms.  The student will participate in instructor led routines.  This class will include discussion of Zumba's history and basic four rhythms.  No dance experience necessary.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of Zumba's basic four rhythms
Ability to adapt to fast and slow rhythms
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting dance movements to varying rhythms
Understanding and applying the history of Zumba to enhance performance
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Keeping pace with the instructor led routines

courseDescription: Students will understand the basic principles of Pilates and will be able to demonstrate the ability of performing beginning and intermediate Pilates exercises with correct form and technique.
Technical and Digital Skills: Performing beginning and intermediate Pilates exercises
Correct form and technique in Pilates
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Giving feedback on Pilates form and technique
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adjusting Pilates exercises to individual fitness level

courseTitle: Topics in Health and Physical Education
courseDescription: A variety of new and innovative courses in lifetime physical activities are offered such as advanced theory class in martial arts, advanced Iaido, self defense seminar, yoga, cross country skiing, yacht racing, racquetball, nautilus, swim conditioning, water safety instructor, scuba and aerobic dance.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting physical activities for individual abilities and needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and leading diverse physical activities

courseTitle: Topics in Health and Physical Education
courseDescription: This course provides an opportunity for in-depth study of selected topics in health and physical education.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge in health and physical education theories
Using digital tools for health education
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective presentation of health and fitness topics

courseTitle: Topics in Health and Physical Education
courseDescription: This course provides an opportunity for in-depth study of selected topics in health and physical education.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of health and physical education topics
Use of digital tools for research and study
Application of health and fitness tracking technologies
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to discuss and explain health and physical education topics
Collaboration in group study and projects
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of health and physical education issues
Development of solutions for health and physical education challenges
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and implementation of health and physical education projects
Leadership in group study and projects
